data.title: UnveilTV’s May Line up
data.meta_description: A look at all the great content streaming and releasing in May 2022
data.text:
At UnveilTV we want you to watch what inspires you. And we want to introduce you to filmmakers and content creators who you may not have met yet. Here’s an in-depth look at the stories and filmmakers featured in May.

For a full list of the Live Premiere and Streaming visit this article.

Unveil Original Series

Dream: 6-part Unveil Original Series

Dream is the inspiring new series from The Kooman Brothers. It’s a series that invites audiences tolive with purpose and to learn to dream.

The original series features the stories of diverse people from around the globe, who found purpose when they embraced their God-given dream. Subjects include Grammy Award-nominated artists, a former Sudanese child soldier, a disaster grief counselor, and a young Canadian boy partnering with a Tanzanian girl to bring about change through a simple stuffed elephant.

Episode 1 : Dream: Find Your Significance — Elijah and Milka, are two young people whose stuffed elephant toy is bringing about economic change in Tanzania; Brittni is a former porn-star who now counsels women to heal and leave the industry; and Phil, an award-winning musician is pursuing his dream again after losing so much after a series of personal setbacks.

Episode 2: World Changers (Robb Nash) — Meet a musician who, after experiencing a near fatal accident, turned his music career into a mission that has helped save over 800 teens from suicide.

Episode 3: From Grief To Purpose (Paul Yin) — Chinese national Paul Yin has traveled the globe bringing hope to those whose lives are torn apart by tragedy, including the families of victims of the mysterious 2014 Malaysian Airlines disaster.

Episode 4: Writing for Jesus Culture (Bryan and Katie Torwalt) — For these two Grammy Award-nominated artists, leading worship and connecting with audiences nationwide becomes a greater challenge with their newborn baby on board for their US tour. A story about how faithfulness and excellence will lead you to your purpose.

Episode 5: Soldier of Peace (Monybany Dau) — Learn how Monybany escaped the trauma of his childhood and is now helping bring restoration to his country.

Episode 6: What is Your Dream? — What do you have in your heart that you know has been placed there by God? Do you know your purpose?

Breath of Life, an Unveil Original Documentary Series

(Streaming for US and International audiences and On-Demand in Canada)

Every breath we take is a miracle and tells us something profound about the nature of God.

Breath of Life will forever change the way you see the creation story. Based on the best-selling book by Daniel Kooman and from the award winning Unveil Studios, Breath of Life explores the three unique breaths that God breathed to shape humanity. With poetic narration by Trevor McNevan (Thousand Foot Krutch), scripture reading by Kim Walker-Smith (Jesus Culture), and commentary from prominent voices like Dallas Jenkins (Creator of The Chosen TV Series), Jen Ledger (Skillet), Dr. Hugh Ross (Astronomer), Tiffany Bluhm (Author) and Ken Shigematsu (Author and Pastor).

Bonus Features: Don’t miss the post-film talk back panels for Parts 1-3 of Breath of Life, featuring the filmmakers, artists and guests like Dallas Jenkins, Blair Linne, Andrew Hyatt and Korey Cooper.

She Has A Name, an Unveil Original Feature Film

How far would you go to bring freedom?

Jason, a lawyer, poses as a john to bring freedom and justice to young girls that have been trafficked into Thailand. While building a legal case against ruthless traffickers, he meets Number 18, a girl forced to work in a busy Bangkok bar only to discover her testimony is key to proving his case. Can he convince her to risk her life to testify for the sake of justice?

She Has A Name explores the global corruption that allows for human sex trafficking across borders and for criminals to thrive off of this industry. A global cast and crew, who collectively represent no less than 10 different nations, came together to make She Has A Name and raise awareness on the prevalence of sex trafficking throughout the world.

The film highlights the devastating toll that human trafficking of minors has on young lives, a global problem that’s fuelled by the demand for underage sex, organized crime, and political corruption. She Has A Name also brings awareness to the fact that risks are high not only for victims of the sex trade, but also for those people who are dedicated to rescuing victims from sex trafficking and rehabilitating them.

Bonus Features: Don’t miss the Kooman Brothers’ Behind the Scenes documentary about the challenges and creativity making the human trafficking drama in Thailand.

The Ladder of My Life, an Unveil Original Documentary

The Ladder of My Lifetells the unbelievable true story of Monybany Minyang Dau who grew up amidst the horror of a genocidal civil war in South Sudan, was a child soldier, walked for six weeks with thousands of others to a refugee camp in Ethiopia, and eventually, came to Canada.

Video Podcasts

Covered by Grace Podcast

In this first episode of the Covered By Grace podcast, we talk all about how we personally came to know Jesus, what that journey looked like for us and how we will never look back!

Covered by Grace video podcasts are exclusively on UnveilTV.

The Official Kooman Brothers Podcast

We’re launching our very own podcast, a conversation about film, faith, family and lots in between. The first episode will drop the first week of May - stay tuned!
